image.altText: A man in a business shirt and tie looks seriously off the camera.

items.synopsis: The report contains highly critical reviews of NT Police processes and concerns raised by prosecutors about the expert witnesses called in the murder case against former police officer Zachary Rolfe.

title.children: Suppression order lifted over controversial police report into death of Kumanjayi Walker

image.altText: A man with blonde hair wearing glasses and a blue t-shirt with tattoos on his left arm sits at a kitchen bench.

items.synopsis: Despite increased rental assistance measures in Tuesday's budget, calls to cap rents are growing louder, with economists saying that step has been successful overseas, however, analysts warn it may make the housing crisis worse.

title.children: Jacob will get an extra $31 a fortnight to put towards his rent. He thinks his landlord will see it as an 'opportunity'

image.altText: A man with a backwards cap holding a football.

items.synopsis: Daniel Hayes was forging a path to a dream career in the AFL 17 years ago — but after leaving the Demons without playing a game, the small forward was left grappling with feelings few understood.

title.children: When Daniel Hayes disappeared from the AFL, he didn't share his pain — now he is suing his junior coach

image.altText: Dutton wearing glasses speaks on the floor of parliament house.

items.synopsis: Peter Dutton failed to sketch a big picture to look like an alternative prime minister in his Thursday night budget reply, writes Michelle Grattan.

title.children: Peter Dutton's concern for the 'working poor' not enough to demonstrate big-picture vision in budget reply

image.altText: A composite of Duchess Sophie and Donald Trump.

items.synopsis: The news Australia is searching for, and all the news that happened while you snoozed: This is The Loop, your quick catch-up for this morning's stories as they happen.

title.children: Duchess's police escort hits woman, and Trump files appeal in sexual assault lawsuit. Catch up with The Loop

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: CNN has cited sources saying the former marine, Daniel Penny, is expected to be charged with manslaughter today. He put a man in a chokehold that killed him on the New York City subway. There have been protests across the city since footage of Jordan Neely being restrained emerged.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: Former US marine to be charged with manslaughter in choking death on subway

children.content: CNN has cited sources saying the former marine, Daniel Penny, is expected to be charged with manslaughter today.
He put a man in a chokehold that killed him on the New York City subway.
There have been protests across the city since footage of Jordan Neely being restrained emerged.
New York police officers respond to the scene where a fight was reported on a subway train, Monday, May 1.

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: WOOHOO! Australia has made it to the final of the Eurovision Song Contest. Australia is represented this year by Perth-based metal-synth band Voyager. The global music spectacle is being held in the British city Liverpool, in place of last year's winner Ukraine. Some of the most competitive countries, including France, Italy, and Israel, have all already secured their spot in this weekend's grand final. It's Australia's final shot at Eurovision for now, as the deal with the European Broadcasting Union is up for renewal this year.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: Australia reaches the Eurovision finals!

children.content: WOOHOO! Australia has made it to the final of the Eurovision Song Contest.
Australia is represented this year by
The global music spectacle is being held in the British city Liverpool, in place of last year's winner Ukraine.
Some of the most competitive countries, including
, have all already secured their spot in this weekend's grand final.
It's Australia's final shot at Eurovision for now, as the deal with the European Broadcasting Union is up for renewal this year.

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: Twitter boss Elon Musk says he's found a replacement CEO for the social media platform, who will be starting in about six weeks. Musk hasn't named the candidate, but says he'll take on the roles of executive chair and chief technology officer. Tesla shares jumped 2.4 per cent when Musk shared the news. Critics say Musk's tenure as chief executive has sullied the platform's integrity, and its regulation has been grossly undermined by thousands of job cuts.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: Musk says Twitter has found its next CEO

children.content: says he's found a replacement CEO for the social media platform, who will be starting in
, but says he'll take on the roles of executive chair and chief technology officer.
Critics say Musk's tenure as chief executive has sullied the platform's integrity, and its regulation has been grossly undermined by thousands of job cuts.

image.altText: Man wearing white Islamic cap with long brown beard sits in study with books behind and window with laced curtains behind

items.synopsis: A convicted terrorist is being kept in prison using orders that have been condemned in a Home Affairs inquiry. The department kept that report's findings secret — until now.

title.children: Home Affairs releases secret report trashing orders keeping terrorist behind bars

image.altText: A crowd is seen gathered outside NT Parliament House.

items.synopsis: The rally, the third in three months in the Northern Territory's capital, follows a number of high-profile violent incidents in Darwin this year.

title.children: Despair and anger voiced at another anti-crime rally in Darwin

image.altText: A woman in a green blazer sits behind a desk with a microphone

items.synopsis: The union representing public servants is still in the dark about elements of a 2 per cent pay increase promised more than six months ago, with the NT government taken to the Fair Work Commission.

title.children: Union takes NT government to Fair Work Commission over public service pay offer

image.altText: Profile shot of Ms R Rubuntja

items.synopsis: The Albanese government allocated $194 million to prevent domestic violence against First Nations women in Tuesday's budget. With some of the highest rates of domestic violence in the world, is it enough?

title.children: 'Three friends of mine have been killed by their partners': Are we on track to end violence against women?

image.altText: Lesley Trotter in khaki hiking gear sitting on a rock with other walkers.

items.synopsis: Police believe the 78-year-old was killed the day she was reported missing — her body put in a wheelie bin near her home in Toowong, which was then collected by a rubbish truck.

title.children: Dumped in a bin outside her house six weeks ago, Lesley Trotter's disappearance remains a mystery

image.altText: A handsome young man poses in a black and white photo with his hand on his chin

items.synopsis: Pita Limjaroenrat is a charismatic young businessman-turned-politician whose party has been climbing the polls. Here's how Move Forward is making is mark on mainstream Thai politics.

title.children: Three years ago, Pita Limjaroenrat took the reins of a party in tatters. He now wants to be Thailand's next PM

image.altText: A teenage girl smiles while lying in a hospital bed, as her mother holds the girl's hand to her cheek in support.

items.synopsis: Australian gymnast Ava Costa was on a possible track for the Olympics, but now faces a long recovery after a spinal injury from a training fall — prompting gymnastic greats to send their support.

title.children: Messages of love lift the spirits of injured Australian gymnastics star Ava Costa

image.altText: Imran Khan court

items.synopsis: Pakistan's Supreme Court orders the release of former prime minister Imran Khan, after his arrest sparked countrywide violence.

title.children: Pakistan's top court orders release of Imran Khan, who calls his arrest a 'kidnapping'

image.altText: James McConville and Simon Stuart stand in military dress. Both are facing to the left, with the US General saluting.

items.synopsis: Australia's recent army overhaul will see a greater focus on missiles, but a senior American military general says cutting back on ground vehicles may be a mistake.

title.children: Tanks crucial to 'winning', US Army general says after Australia cuts back spending on fighting vehicles

image.altText: A truck sits in a field as a soldier aims a shoulder-mounted rocket laucher, while another looks through binoculars.

items.synopsis: Britain has become the first country to start supplying long-range cruise missiles to Ukraine — a move that will allow Kyiv's forces to hit Russian troops and supply dumps deep behind the front lines.

title.children: Britain to supply Ukraine with long-range cruise missiles

image.altText: young person with curly blonde hair with nighttime cityscape behind them

items.synopsis: Australia's rental vacancies are at an all-time low, but for the trans and gender diverse community, the options are even more limited.

title.children: Eden has been sleeping on the street for nearly all of 2023. It still feels safer than a hostel

image.altText: A woman in an orange jumper sits in a lounge chair.

items.synopsis: A Mildura mum says she has turned to Afterpay to cover medication for her disabled son while another woman says she would rather go without medicine than pay on credit.

title.children: Buy now, pay later use surges as families struggle to afford essential medication

image.altText: A pipe in the ground with a man in the distance

items.synopsis: A mayor in western New South Wales says his town is "in limbo" after the budget for a water security project blew out by $4.7 million.

title.children: Pipe connected to nowhere all that remains of $4m project to droughtproof town's water supply

image.altText: Barrels of whiskey are stacked on top of each other in a distllery.

items.synopsis: India has become the world's largest consumer of whisky by volume.

title.children: India is responsible for guzzling more than half the world's whisky

image.altText: An LNG tanker

items.synopsis: Energy company Eni has quietly revived plans to develop a gas field in the Timor Sea which contains some of the most carbon-intensive gas in Australia, "far more than any other gas field that is being developed".

title.children: Italian company moves ahead with 'carbon bomb' gas field in Timor Sea

image.altText: A young woman with traditional paint on her forehead looks into the distance.

items.synopsis: First Nations women from around Australia have gathered at a historic summit to discuss how to improve gender equality in their communities.

title.children: From the Kimberley region to the nation's capital, Calli-Rose has made a journey for change

image.altText: An older man with greying light hair and glasses wearing a suit and tie stands in front of a blue Reserve Bank of Australia wall

items.synopsis: Previously unpublished internal research from the Reserve Bank estimates that Australia's risk of recession over this year and next could be as high as 80 per cent.

title.children: RBA research puts Australian recession risk at up to 80 per cent by 2024

image.altText: Peter Dutton sits in the House of Representatives

items.synopsis: Peter Dutton uses his budget reply speech to lay the blame for any future increase to interest rates at the feet of the Albanese government.

title.children: Dutton accuses Albanese government of fuelling inflation in budget reply

image.altText: Red circular particles with some white circular particles on a blue background.

items.synopsis: The World Health Organization says mpox is no longer a public health emergency, ending a nearly year-long alert for the disease.

title.children: World Health Organization declares end to mpox public health emergency

image.altText: Actor Michael J. Fox, a man with short dark hair with grey patches, cups his chin in his hands, looking thoughtful.

items.synopsis: A candid new documentary is a fitting tribute to a performer who refuses to meet life's curve balls with anything less than his signature good humour.

title.children: 'I was an acid bath of fear': Michael J Fox opens up on success and struggle in new doco

image.altText: Balloon windward

items.synopsis: Australia's best balloon pilots have gathered in the Avon Valley, 100km east of Perth, for the 23rd National Hot Air Ballooning Championships.

title.children: Skies light up with balloons as best pilots compete in Western Australia

image.altText: man sitting next to bride

items.synopsis: A Sydney "self-taught trader" — charged with allegedly defrauding "mum-and-dad-type" investors of more than $24 million — has been refused bail.

title.children: Bail refused for man who allegedly gambled away 'almost $25 million' in investor funds

image.altText: A police car blocks a road outside of a church in the desert on a movie set

items.synopsis: The prop supplier for Rust says the movie's armourer told him she bought the same type of ammunition as the live round that killed the cinematographer.

title.children: Armourer bought live rounds before Rust shooting, prop supplier told police
